尼.definition: Buddhist nun; (often used in phonetic spellings)

尼亞加拉瀑布.pinyin: ní yà jiā lā pù bù

尼人.definition: Neanderthal (abbr. for 尼安德特人[Ni2 an1 de2 te4 ren2])

尼克松.definition: Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974; surname Nixon

尼克森.definition: Nixon (name); Richard M Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974

尼勒克.definition: Nilka County or Nilqa nahiyisi in Ili Kazakh Autonomous Prefecture 伊犁哈薩克自治州|伊犁哈萨克自治州[Yi1 li2 Ha1 sa4 ke4 Zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Xinjiang

尼勒克縣.definition: Nilka County or Nilqa nahiyisi in Ili Kazakh Autonomous Prefecture 伊犁哈薩克自治州|伊犁哈萨克自治州[Yi1 li2 Ha1 sa4 ke4 Zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Xinjiang

尼厄麗德.definition: Nereids (Greek sea nymphs, fifty daughters of Nereus and Doris); Nereid, moon of Neptune

尼哥底母.definition: Nicodemus, prominent Jew of the time of Christ, mentioned in the Gospel of John

尼布楚條約.definition: Treaty of Nerchinsk (1689) between Qing China and Russia

尼散月.definition: Nisan, the first month of the ecclesiastical year in the Jewish calendar

尼日爾.definition: Niger (African state); Niger River, West Africa

尼木.definition: Nyêmo county, Tibetan: Snye mo rdzong in Lhasa 拉薩|拉萨[La1 sa4], Tibet

尼木縣.definition: Nyêmo county, Tibetan: Snye mo rdzong in Lhasa 拉薩|拉萨[La1 sa4], Tibet

尼泊爾鷦鶥.definition: (bird species of China) Nepal cupwing; immaculate cupwing; Nepal wren-babbler (Pnoepyga immaculata)

尼爾遜.definition: Nelson or Nillson (name); Horatio Nelson (1758-1805), British naval hero

尼特族.definition: (Tw) (neologism c. 2007) young person who is not studying, working or being trained for work (loanword from NEET: not in education, employment or training)

尼瑪.definition: (Internet slang) alternative for 你媽|你妈[ni3 ma1]; (transcription from Tibetan) the sun

尼米茲號.definition: Nimitz class, US nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, 8 in commission since 1975

尼赫魯.definition: Jawaharlal Nehru (1889-1964), Indian politician, first prime minister 1947-1964

尼雅.definition: Niya, ancient kingdom near Khotan in Xinjiang, 1st century BC-4th century AD
